original: Billgren, Karl Hugo, praktiserande läkare, Norrköping, f. 14/7/87 i Norrköp. av folksk:lär. Pontus B. o. Hilda Elisabet Jonsson. G. 16 m. Ingeborg Gustava Fredga. — Mogiex. i Norr-köp. 06, med. kand. i Upps. 10, med. Hc. i Sthlm 16. Tf. las:und:läk. i Växjö o. Jönköp. 12, tf. und :läk. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. ögonavd. 14, v. med. avd. där 17, und:läk. v. Allm. för-sörjn linrättn. i Sthlm sjukh. 17-21, v. Sthlms epidrsjukh. 21, prakt. läk. samt uppr. förordn. s. förste o. andre stadsläk. i Norrköp. 21-30, andre stadsläkare där 30-45, prakt. läk. där sed. 45. Fältläk:stip. i res. 12, bat :läk. i Fik res. 16-20, därund. mil:läk:för-ordn. v. oHka truppförb.
translated: Billgren, Karl Hugo, practicing physician, Norrköping, b. July 14th, 1887 in Norrköping, son of primary school teacher Pontus B. and Hilda Elisabet Jonsson. Married Ingeborg Gustava Fredga in 1916. Graduated as a pharmacist in Norrköping in 1906, as a medical candidate in Uppsala in 1910, and as a medical doctor in Stockholm in 1916. Acting resident doctor in Växjö and Jönköping in 1912, acting assistant doctor at Sabbatsberg Hospital Eye Department in 1914, medical department there in 1917, assistant doctor at the Public Assistance Institution in Stockholm Hospital from 1917-1921, Stockholm Epidemic Hospital in 1921, practicing physician and appointed as the first and second city physician in Norrköping from 1921-1930, and as the second city physician there from 1930-1945, and has been practicing as a physician there since 1945. Field medical scholarship in reserves in 1912, battalion physician in the Finnish War in reserves from 1916-1920, and military medical ordnance officer of increasing military units.

employer.name: Public Assistance Institution in Stockholm Hospital

hasOccupation.name: Military Medicine
